name: BossConstructor
description: Scavenge modules, combine them in the deadliest and most efficient ways imaginable, and fly your very own spaceship through alien space with BossConstructor. Thousands of procedurally generated galaxies await you and your space-faring collection of assembled modules to explore them.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista/7/8/10 Processor: Intel Core i3-6100, AMD FX-6100 or better Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 280, AMD Radeon HD 5770 or better Storage: 400 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7/8/10 Processor: Intel Core i5-3570K, AMD FX-6300 or better Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 560, AMD Radeon HD 6850 or better Storage: 500 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Challenging learning curve, but once you get the hang of it, this game will totally engross you. Some camera wonkiness and balance issues, but I expect these will improve with time.
umm after the first time i played it, it started crashing like crazy. it was fun while it lasted.

Fantastic game to waste a few hours!! Ship design is fun and blowing things up feels good!!  Does have some issues with performance now and again (the odd crash) and the ship nuilding parts could have clearer explanations as to what they do/are.  All in all, worth picking up if you like building 2d ships and then going battling others!! or like me your old and remember playing asteroids for far to long on your Atari!
